- Added `stop()` function to handle stopping in-progress requests
- Added timeout management with `timeoutRef`
- Removed PromptInputProvider wrapper (not needed in the new layout)
- Removed unused imports (Button, ImageIcon, etc.)

Perfect! I've successfully extracted the @ functionality into its own component. Here's a summary of what was done:

## Created `ChatPromptInputFiles.tsx`

This new component encapsulates:
- The @ button with `AtSignIcon`
- The Popover with file selection menu
- Command input with search functionality
- File list display (Active Tabs, Other Files)
- Auto-focus logic when the menu opens

## Updated `ChatPromptInput.tsx`

Simplified by:
- Removing all the file-related UI code
- Removing unused imports (Command components, Popover, AtSignIcon, sampleFiles)
- Removing the `commandInputRef` (now internal to the child component)
- Replacing the entire Popover structure with a single `<ChatPromptInputFiles>` component
- Keeping the state management (`isAtMenuOpen`, `setIsAtMenuOpen`) and @ detection logic in the parent

The parent component now controls the open/closed state and detects when "@" is typed, while the child component handles all the UI rendering and internal focus management. This makes the code much cleaner and more maintainable at:

input.plan:
# Implementation Plan: File Reference Feature for Chat Prompt

## Overview
Add file reference functionality to the chat prompt input, allowing users to type `@` to search and insert file paths, similar to IDE autocomplete features.

## Key Components to Modify/Create

### 1. **ChatPromptInputFiles.tsx** (Major Changes)
- Add `projectId` prop from parent
- Use `useProjectFiles(projectId)` hook to fetch file tree via API
- Flatten file tree into searchable list of file paths
- Implement fuzzy search using existing pattern from FileTree
- Track "added files" state (files currently referenced in prompt)
- Add checkbox/checkmark UI to show which files are added
- Handle file selection to insert relative path at cursor position
- Support file removal by unchecking

### 2. **ChatPromptInput.tsx** (Minor Changes)
- Extract project ID from URL using `useParams<{ id: string }>()`
- Pass `projectId` to `ChatPromptInputFiles` component
- Track cursor position in textarea for file path insertion
- Manage list of added file paths
- Sync added files with textarea content (parse `@path` references)
- Update `handleTextChange` to track cursor position
- Add helper to insert file path at cursor position
- Add helper to parse/extract file references from text

### 3. **ProjectChat.tsx** (No Changes Needed)
Already passes project `id` through URL params, which ChatPromptInput can access

### 4. **Helper Utilities** (New)
Create utility functions:
- `flattenFileTree(tree: FileTreeItem[]): string[]` - Convert tree to flat list of paths
- `fuzzyMatch(query: string, text: string): boolean` - Fuzzy search matching
- `extractFileReferences(text: string): string[]` - Parse `@path` from text
- `insertAtCursor(text: string, insert: string, position: number): string` - Insert text at position
- `getRelativePath(path: string, projectRoot: string): string` - Get relative path

## Implementation Steps

### Step 1: Update ChatPromptInput.tsx
- Import `useParams` from react-router-dom
- Extract `id` from route params
- Add state for cursor position tracking
- Add state for added file paths
- Pass projectId to ChatPromptInputFiles
- Update handleTextChange to track cursor position
- Add file path insertion logic
- Add file reference parsing/syncing

### Step 2: Create Utility Functions
- Create `@/client/lib/fileUtils.ts` with helper functions
- Implement flattenFileTree
- Implement fuzzyMatch (can reuse from FileTree pattern)
- Implement extractFileReferences (regex to find @paths)
- Implement insertAtCursor
- Implement getRelativePath

### Step 3: Update ChatPromptInputFiles.tsx
- Add `projectId` prop to interface
- Use `useProjectFiles(projectId)` hook
- Flatten file tree on load
- Add state for search query
- Add state for added files (passed from parent)
- Implement fuzzy filtering
- Update UI to show two sections:
  - "Added Files" - files currently in prompt (with checkmarks, can uncheck to remove)
  - "All Files" - filtered search results (can click to add)
- Handle file selection to notify parent
- Show loading/error states from API

### Step 4: Update Command List UI
- Refactor CommandGroups to show:
  1. "Added Files" section at top (only if files are added)
     - Show file paths that are currently in the prompt
     - Include checkmark icon
     - Click to remove from prompt
  2. "Search Results" section
     - Filtered by search query
     - Click to add to prompt at cursor position
- Style selected/added files differently

### Step 5: Integration & Polish
- Test @ trigger opening menu
- Test fuzzy search filtering
- Test file insertion at cursor
- Test file removal via unchecking
- Test syncing between textarea and added files list
- Handle edge cases (empty results, loading states, errors)
- Add keyboard navigation (arrow keys, enter to select)

## Data Flow

```
ProjectChat (has projectId in URL params)
  └─> ChatPromptInput (extracts id from useParams)
      ├─> Manages textarea state & cursor position
      ├─> Tracks added file references
      └─> ChatPromptInputFiles (receives projectId)
          ├─> useProjectFiles(projectId) - fetches from /api/projects/:id/files
          ├─> Flattens tree to searchable list
          ├─> Fuzzy filters based on search
          └─> Returns selected file to parent for insertion
```

## Technical Details

- **File Path Format**: Relative to project root (e.g., `src/components/Chat.tsx`)
- **Search Algorithm**: Fuzzy match (reuse from FileTree component)
- **Insertion**: At cursor position, replaces `@` trigger
- **Tracking**: Parse textarea content for `@path/to/file` patterns
- **API**: Reuse existing `/api/projects/:id/files` endpoint

## Edge Cases to Handle

1. User types @ but closes menu without selecting
2. User manually edits/deletes file references in textarea
3. File path contains spaces or special characters
4. Loading state while fetching files
5. API error when fetching files
6. Empty project (no files)
7. Multiple @ symbols in text
8. Cursor position at start/middle/end of text

message.content: what fuzzy search library do you recommend and why?

content.text:
I recommend **Fuse.js** for this use case. Here's why:

## Why Fuse.js

### 1. **Perfect for File Search**
- Designed specifically for fuzzy string matching in lists
- Handles the exact use case: searching filenames like "ptin" → "PromptInput.tsx"
- Supports weighted search (can prioritize filename over path)

### 2. **Lightweight & Fast**
- ~12KB minified
- No dependencies
- Fast enough for real-time search as user types
- Can handle hundreds/thousands of files without lag

### 3. **Easy to Use**
```typescript
import Fuse from 'fuse.js';

const files = [
  { filename: 'ChatPromptInput.tsx', path: 'src/client/components/chat' },
  { filename: 'useSessionMessages.ts', path: 'src/client/hooks' },
  // ...
];

const fuse = new Fuse(files, {
  keys: ['filename', 'path'],  // Search both
  threshold: 0.4,               // Balance between fuzzy and strict
  includeScore: true,           // For sorting by relevance
});

const results = fuse.search('pmpin'); // Finds "ChatPromptInput.tsx"
```

### 4. **Configurable**
- Adjust "fuzziness" with `threshold` (0 = exact, 1 = very fuzzy)
- Weight keys differently (e.g., filename more important than path)
- Highlight matching characters if desired
- Sort by relevance score

### 5. **Already Common in React Ecosystems**
- Used by many popular libraries (VS Code uses similar algorithm)
- Well-maintained and tested
- Good TypeScript support

## Alternative Options

**If you want to avoid dependencies:**
- **Custom implementation**: Use the existing `filterFiles` logic from FileTree.tsx (simple substring matching)
- Upgrade it with basic fuzzy logic (check if query chars appear in order)

**Other libraries:**
- **match-sorter**: Similar to Fuse.js but slightly different API
- **fuzzy**: Lighter weight but less features
- **lunr.js**: Overkill for this use case (full-text search engine)

## My Recommendation

**Use Fuse.js** - It's the sweet spot of:
- ✅ Feature-rich enough for good UX
- ✅ Simple API
- ✅ Small bundle size
- ✅ Proven and reliable
- ✅ TypeScript support

If bundle size is critical and you want something simpler, the existing substring search from FileTree.tsx would work but won't feel as polished as true fuzzy search.

- `getFileIcon(filename: string): ReactNode` - Return appropriate icon/badge based on extension
- `extractFileReferences(text: string): string[]` - Parse `@path/to/file` patterns from text
- `insertAtCursor(text: string, insert: string, position: number): { text: string, newPosition: number }` - Insert text at cursor

Types:
```typescript
interface FileItem {
  filename: string;      // "ChatPromptInput.tsx"
  directory: string;     // "src/client/components/chat"
  fullPath: string;      // "src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInput.tsx"
  extension: string;     // "tsx"
}
```

### 2. **ChatPromptInputFiles.tsx** (Major Refactor)
- Add `projectId` prop (string)
- Add `onFileSelect` prop (callback: `(filePath: string) => void`)
- Add `addedFiles` prop (string[] of currently added file paths)
- Use `useProjectFiles(projectId)` hook to fetch file tree
- Use Fuse.js for fuzzy search:
  ```typescript
  const fuse = new Fuse(flattenedFiles, {
    keys: ['filename', 'fullPath'],
    threshold: 0.4,
    includeScore: true,
  });
  ```
- Update UI to match screenshot design:
  - File type badge/icon on left
  - Filename prominently displayed
  - Directory path in muted color on right
- Show two sections:
  - **"Added Files"** - Files currently in prompt (with checkmarks, can click to remove)
  - **"Search Results"** - Fuzzy filtered files (click to add)
- Handle loading and error states from API

### 3. **ChatPromptInput.tsx** (Moderate Changes)
- Import `useParams` from react-router-dom to get project ID
- Add state: `cursorPosition` (number)
- Add state: `addedFiles` (string[] - file paths currently in prompt)
- Track cursor position in `handleTextChange`
- Create `handleFileSelect` callback:
  - Insert file path at cursor position (replace `@`)
  - Update cursor position
  - Add file to `addedFiles` list
- Create `handleFileRemove` callback:
  - Remove all instances of file path from textarea
  - Remove from `addedFiles` list
- Pass props to `ChatPromptInputFiles`:
  - `projectId={id}`
  - `onFileSelect={handleFileSelect}`
  - `addedFiles={addedFiles}`

### 4. **File Type Badge Component** (`@/client/components/ui/file-badge.tsx`) - NEW FILE
Small badge component for file types:
- TS/TSX: Blue badge
- JS/JSX: Yellow badge
- JSON: Gray badge
- MD: Green badge
- Default: Gray file icon

## Implementation Steps

### Step 1: Install Dependencies
```bash
pnpm add fuse.js
```

### Step 2: Create `fileUtils.ts`
- Implement `flattenFileTree` (recursive traversal)
- Implement `getFileIcon` (extension-based icon selection)
- Implement `extractFileReferences` (regex: `/@[\w\/\-\.]+/g`)
- Implement `insertAtCursor` (string manipulation)

### Step 3: Create File Badge Component
- Small colored badge for file extensions
- Matches design from screenshot

### Step 4: Update ChatPromptInput.tsx
- Get project ID from URL params
- Add cursor position tracking
- Add file management logic
- Implement insertion/removal callbacks
- Pass necessary props to ChatPromptInputFiles

### Step 5: Refactor ChatPromptInputFiles.tsx
- Accept new props (projectId, onFileSelect, addedFiles)
- Fetch files using useProjectFiles hook
- Flatten file tree on load
- Initialize Fuse.js with flattened files
- Implement search with Fuse.js
- Update UI to match screenshot design
- Split into "Added" and "Search Results" sections
- Add click handlers for add/remove

### Step 6: Testing & Polish
- Test @ trigger
- Test fuzzy search ("pmpin" → "ChatPromptInput.tsx")
- Test file insertion at various cursor positions
- Test file removal
- Test keyboard navigation
- Handle edge cases (empty search, no files, API errors)

## Data Flow

```
ProjectChat (URL: /projects/:id/chat/:sessionId)
  └─> ChatPromptInput
      ├─> Extract id from useParams()
      ├─> Track cursor position
      ├─> Track addedFiles[]
      ├─> handleFileSelect(path) → insert at cursor
      ├─> handleFileRemove(path) → remove from text
      └─> ChatPromptInputFiles
          ├─> useProjectFiles(projectId) → fetch from API
          ├─> flattenFileTree() → FileItem[]
          ├─> new Fuse(files) → fuzzy search
          ├─> Filter on search query
          ├─> Render with filename + path UI
          └─> onFileSelect(path) → notify parent
```

## Technical Details

- **Fuzzy Search**: Fuse.js with threshold 0.4 (balanced fuzzy matching)
- **Search Keys**: Prioritize filename, include fullPath as secondary
- **File Format**: Insert as relative path (e.g., `@src/components/Chat.tsx`)
- **Insertion**: Replace `@` character at cursor position
- **Tracking**: Parse textarea for `@path` patterns to keep addedFiles in sync
- **API**: Reuse existing `/api/projects/:id/files` endpoint

## Visual Design

### File List Item Structure
```
[TS] ChatPromptInput.tsx     .../components/chat
 ↑           ↑                        ↑
icon    filename (bold)        path (muted)
```

### Sections
1. **"Added Files"** (if addedFiles.length > 0)
   - Checkmark icon
   - Click to remove
   
2. **"Search Results"** / **"All Files"**
   - Filtered by Fuse.js
   - Click to add

Test edge cases: empty project, API errors, special chars in filenames ### Step 8: Run Full Test Suite ```bash pnpm test ``` - Ensure all tests pass - Review coverage report - Aim for >80% coverage on new code ## Test Structure ### Unit Tests (`fileUtils.test.ts`) - Pure function tests - Fast, isolated - No dependencies on React or DOM - Test edge cases thoroughly ### Component Unit Tests (`file-badge.test.tsx`) - Test rendering logic - Test prop variations - No external dependencies ### Integration Tests (`ChatPromptInput.test.tsx`, `ChatPromptInputFiles.test.tsx`) - Test component interactions - Mock API calls (useProjectFiles) - Test user interactions (typing, clicking) - Test state management - Test callbacks between parent/child components ## Data Flow ``` ProjectChat (route: /projects/:id/chat/:sessionId) └─> ChatPromptInput ├─> useParams() → extract id ├─> Track cursor position ├─> handleFileSelect(path): │ ├─> insertAtCursor(text, path, cursorPosition) │ └─> setIsAtMenuOpen(false) ├─> handleFileRemove(path): │ └─> removeAllOccurrences(text, path) └─> ChatPromptInputFiles ├─> useProjectFiles(projectId) → API fetch ├─> Parse added files when menu opens ├─> flattenFileTree() → FileItem[] ├─> new Fuse(files) → search instance ├─> filter with Fuse.search(query) ├─> Render two sections └─> Call onFileSelect/onFileRemove ``` ## Technical Specifications - "Added Files" - Parsed from textarea, checkmarks, removable 2. "Search Results" - Fuzzy filtered, clickable to add

content.text:
Good question! Let me clarify:

**File path extraction regex is NOT for search** - that's what Fuse.js handles.

**The regex is for parsing the textarea content** to find which files are already referenced in the prompt text. 

For example, if the textarea contains:
```
Review src/components/Chat.tsx and apps/web/src/utils.ts for bugs
```

The regex extracts: `["src/components/Chat.tsx", "apps/web/src/utils.ts"]`

This is used to:
1. Show the "Added Files" section when you open the @ menu
2. Know which files to remove when you uncheck one

So:
- **Fuse.js** = Search/filter files when typing in the @ menu
- **Regex** = Parse existing file paths from the textarea to track what's already added

Does that make sense? We need both!

Perfect! Let me continue with the spec generation. One more question:

**Question 2**: For the file type badge component, should we create individual badge variants or use a single component with dynamic styling?

**Suggestions**
1. Single component with color mapping - `<FileTypeBadge extension="tsx" />` that internally determines color (recommended)
2. Separate badge variants - `<TSBadge />`, `<JSBadge />`, etc. for each file type
3. Other - user specifies

**Reasoning**: I recommend option 1 because it's more maintainable, follows DRY principles, and makes it easier to add new file types without creating new components. The badge just needs to map extension → color dynamically.

# Feature: File Picker for Chat Prompt

## What We're Building

A file reference system that allows users to type `@` in the chat prompt to search and insert file paths from the current project. Uses fuzzy search (Fuse.js) for quick file discovery and displays files with a clean UI showing filename and directory path. Automatically tracks which files are referenced in the prompt.

## User Story

As a chat user
I want to quickly reference project files by typing `@` and searching
So that I can easily add file context to my prompts without manually typing full paths

## Technical Approach

Extract project ID from URL params, fetch file tree via existing API (`/api/projects/:id/files`), flatten the tree structure, and implement fuzzy search using Fuse.js. Use a controlled Popover component that opens on `@` trigger or button click. Parse textarea content to track added files, insert paths at cursor position, and support removal of all file occurrences. Component structure separates concerns: ChatPromptInput manages state/logic, ChatPromptInputFiles handles UI/search.

## Files to Touch

### Existing Files

- `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInput.tsx` - Add project ID extraction, cursor tracking, file insertion/removal logic
- `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInputFiles.tsx` - Major refactor to add file fetching, fuzzy search, and two-section UI
- `apps/web/package.json` - Add fuse.js dependency

### New Files

- `apps/web/src/client/lib/fileUtils.ts` - Utility functions for file operations (flatten tree, parse references, cursor insertion)
- `apps/web/src/client/lib/fileUtils.test.ts` - Unit tests for file utilities
- `apps/web/src/client/components/ui/file-badge.tsx` - File type badge component with color mapping
- `apps/web/src/client/components/ui/file-badge.test.tsx` - Unit tests for file badge
- `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInput.test.tsx` - Integration tests for prompt input
- `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInputFiles.test.tsx` - Integration tests for file picker

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Foundation

Create utility functions and types for file operations. Set up file tree flattening, path parsing, cursor position manipulation, and file type detection. Install Fuse.js dependency. Create comprehensive unit tests to ensure all utilities work correctly before integration.

### Phase 2: Core Implementation

Build the file badge component for visual file type indicators. Update ChatPromptInput to track cursor position and manage file insertion/removal. Refactor ChatPromptInputFiles to fetch files from API, implement Fuse.js search, and build the two-section UI (Added Files + Search Results) matching the design specification.

### Phase 3: Integration

Connect all pieces together, ensure proper data flow from parent to child components, handle edge cases (empty projects, API errors, special characters), add keyboard navigation, and validate the complete user flow from typing `@` to inserting file paths.

## Step by Step Tasks

**IMPORTANT: Execute every step in order, top to bottom**

### 1: Install Dependencies

<!-- prettier-ignore -->
- [ ] 1.1 Install Fuse.js for fuzzy searching
        - Run: `cd apps/web && pnpm add fuse.js`
        - Expected: fuse.js added to package.json dependencies
- [ ] 1.2 Install testing dependencies (if not already installed)
        - Run: `cd apps/web && pnpm add -D @testing-library/react @testing-library/jest-dom @testing-library/user-event vitest @vitest/ui jsdom`
        - Expected: Testing libraries added to devDependencies
        - Note: Skip if already installed

#### Completion Notes

### 2: Create File Utilities

<!-- prettier-ignore -->
- [ ] 2.1 Create fileUtils.ts with TypeScript types
        - File: `apps/web/src/client/lib/fileUtils.ts`
        - Define `FileItem` interface with: filename, directory, fullPath, extension
        - Define `FileTypeInfo` interface with: label, color
- [ ] 2.2 Implement flattenFileTree function
        - Recursively traverse FileTreeItem[] structure
        - Extract filename from path (last segment)
        - Extract directory from path (all but last segment)
        - Extract extension from filename (after last dot)
        - Return flat array of FileItem objects
- [ ] 2.3 Implement extractFileReferences function
        - Use regex: `/[a-zA-Z0-9\/\.\-_]+\.[a-z]{2,4}/g` to match file paths
        - Parse textarea content and extract all matching paths
        - Return array of unique file paths
        - Handle empty string edge case
- [ ] 2.4 Implement insertAtCursor function
        - Take current text, insertion string, and cursor position
        - Split text at cursor position
        - Insert new string between parts
        - Calculate new cursor position (after inserted text)
        - Return object with new text and cursor position
- [ ] 2.5 Implement removeAllOccurrences function
        - Use global string replacement to remove all instances
        - Use regex escape to handle special characters in path
        - Return modified text with all occurrences removed
- [ ] 2.6 Implement getFileTypeInfo function
        - Map extensions to file type info (label and color)
        - TS/TSX: label "TS", color "rgb(59, 130, 246)" (blue)
        - JS/JSX: label "JS", color "rgb(234, 179, 8)" (yellow)
        - JSON: label "JSON", color "rgb(107, 114, 128)" (gray)
        - MD: label "MD", color "rgb(34, 197, 94)" (green)
        - Default: label "FILE", color "rgb(156, 163, 175)" (light gray)

#### Completion Notes

### 3: Write Unit Tests for File Utilities

<!-- prettier-ignore -->
- [ ] 3.1 Create fileUtils.test.ts
        - File: `apps/web/src/client/lib/fileUtils.test.ts`
        - Setup test imports and describe blocks

        - Test: Deep nesting (3+ levels) works

        - Test: Finds single file path in text
        - Test: Finds multiple file paths
        - Test: Returns empty array for no matches
        - Test: Handles paths with hyphens and underscores
        - Test: Doesn't match incomplete paths
- [ ] 3.4 Test insertAtCursor
        - Test: Insert at position 0 (beginning)
        - Test: Insert at middle position
        - Test: Insert at end position
        - Test: Returns correct new cursor position
        - Test: Handles empty string
- [ ] 3.5 Test removeAllOccurrences
        - Test: Removes single occurrence
        - Test: Removes multiple occurrences
        - Test: Returns unchanged if path not found
        - Test: Doesn't remove partial matches
        - Test: Handles special characters in path
- [ ] 3.6 Test getFileTypeInfo
        - Test: Returns correct info for .ts, .tsx
        - Test: Returns correct info for .js, .jsx
        - Test: Returns correct info for .json, .md
        - Test: Returns default for unknown extension
- [ ] 3.7 Run utility tests
        - Run: `cd apps/web && pnpm test fileUtils.test.ts`
        - Expected: All tests pass, 100% coverage

#### Completion Notes

### 4: Create File Badge Component

<!-- prettier-ignore -->
- [ ] 4.1 Create file-badge.tsx component
        - File: `apps/web/src/client/components/ui/file-badge.tsx`
        - Accept extension prop (string)
        - Use getFileTypeInfo to get label and color
        - Render badge with fixed width (w-12), centered text
        - Apply background color with opacity (bg-opacity-20)
        - Apply text color for label
        - Use rounded corners and small text
- [ ] 4.2 Create file-badge.test.tsx
        - File: `apps/web/src/client/components/ui/file-badge.test.tsx`
        - Test: Renders correct label for each file type
        - Test: Applies correct color classes
        - Test: Has consistent width for all types
        - Test: Handles unknown extension
- [ ] 4.3 Run badge component tests
        - Run: `cd apps/web && pnpm test file-badge.test.tsx`
        - Expected: All tests pass

#### Completion Notes

### 5: Update ChatPromptInput Component

<!-- prettier-ignore -->
- [ ] 5.1 Add imports to ChatPromptInput.tsx
        - File: `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInput.tsx`
        - Import useParams from react-router-dom
        - Import fileUtils functions (insertAtCursor, removeAllOccurrences)
- [ ] 5.2 Extract project ID from URL
        - Use useParams<{ id: string }>() hook
        - Extract id from params
- [ ] 5.3 Add cursor position state
        - Add state: cursorPosition: number, default 0
        - Track in handleTextChange: e.target.selectionStart
        - Update cursorPosition state on every change
- [ ] 5.4 Create handleFileSelect callback
        - Accept filePath parameter (string)
        - Call insertAtCursor with current text, filePath, cursorPosition
        - Update text state with new text
        - Update cursorPosition with new position
        - Close @ menu: setIsAtMenuOpen(false)
        - Refocus textarea with new cursor position
- [ ] 5.5 Create handleFileRemove callback
        - Accept filePath parameter (string)
        - Call removeAllOccurrences with current text and filePath
        - Update text state with cleaned text
        - Keep menu open for immediate feedback
- [ ] 5.6 Pass props to ChatPromptInputFiles
        - Pass projectId={id!}
        - Pass onFileSelect={handleFileSelect}
        - Pass onFileRemove={handleFileRemove}
        - Pass textareaValue={text}

#### Completion Notes

### 6: Refactor ChatPromptInputFiles Component

<!-- prettier-ignore -->
- [ ] 6.1 Update ChatPromptInputFiles props interface
        - File: `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInputFiles.tsx`
        - Add projectId: string
        - Add onFileSelect: (filePath: string) => void
        - Add onFileRemove: (filePath: string) => void
        - Add textareaValue: string
- [ ] 6.2 Add imports
        - Import useProjectFiles from @/client/hooks/useFiles
        - Import Fuse from fuse.js
        - Import flattenFileTree, extractFileReferences from fileUtils
        - Import FileTypeBadge component
        - Import useMemo, useEffect hooks
- [ ] 6.3 Fetch project files
        - Use useProjectFiles(projectId) hook
        - Store in: data, isLoading, error
- [ ] 6.4 Flatten file tree
        - Use useMemo to flatten when data changes
        - Call flattenFileTree(data || [])
        - Store in: flattenedFiles
- [ ] 6.5 Setup Fuse.js search
        - Create Fuse instance in useMemo
        - Keys: filename (weight 0.7), fullPath (weight 0.3)
        - Threshold: 0.4
        - includeScore: true
        - Store in: fuse
- [ ] 6.6 Parse added files when menu opens
        - Add useEffect with dependency on [open, textareaValue]
        - When open is true, call extractFileReferences(textareaValue)
        - Store results in local state: addedFiles (string[])
- [ ] 6.7 Implement search filtering
        - Add searchQuery state (string)
        - If searchQuery is empty, show all files
        - Otherwise, use fuse.search(searchQuery)
        - Extract items from Fuse results
        - Store in: filteredFiles
- [ ] 6.8 Update UI structure
        - Keep existing Popover, PopoverTrigger, PopoverContent
        - Inside PopoverContent, render PromptInputCommand
        - PromptInputCommandInput with ref, onChange for searchQuery
        - PromptInputCommandList for results
- [ ] 6.9 Render "Added Files" section
        - Show PromptInputCommandGroup heading="Added Files"

- [ ] 6.10 Render "Search Results" section
        - Show PromptInputCommandSeparator if addedFiles exist
        - Show PromptInputCommandGroup heading="Search Results"
        - Map over filteredFiles
        - Filter out files already in addedFiles
        - Render PromptInputCommandItem with:
          - FileTypeBadge with extension

toolUseResult.content:
# Feature: File Picker for Chat Prompt

## What We're Building

A file reference system that allows users to type `@` in the chat prompt to search and insert file paths from the current project. Uses fuzzy search (Fuse.js) for quick file discovery and displays files with a clean UI showing filename and directory path. Automatically tracks which files are referenced in the prompt.

## User Story

As a chat user
I want to quickly reference project files by typing `@` and searching
So that I can easily add file context to my prompts without manually typing full paths

## Technical Approach

Extract project ID from URL params, fetch file tree via existing API (`/api/projects/:id/files`), flatten the tree structure, and implement fuzzy search using Fuse.js. Use a controlled Popover component that opens on `@` trigger or button click. Parse textarea content to track added files, insert paths at cursor position, and support removal of all file occurrences. Component structure separates concerns: ChatPromptInput manages state/logic, ChatPromptInputFiles handles UI/search.

## Files to Touch

### Existing Files

- `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInput.tsx` - Add project ID extraction, cursor tracking, file insertion/removal logic
- `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInputFiles.tsx` - Major refactor to add file fetching, fuzzy search, and two-section UI
- `apps/web/package.json` - Add fuse.js dependency

### New Files

- `apps/web/src/client/lib/fileUtils.ts` - Utility functions for file operations (flatten tree, parse references, cursor insertion)
- `apps/web/src/client/lib/fileUtils.test.ts` - Unit tests for file utilities
- `apps/web/src/client/components/ui/file-badge.tsx` - File type badge component with color mapping
- `apps/web/src/client/components/ui/file-badge.test.tsx` - Unit tests for file badge
- `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInput.test.tsx` - Integration tests for prompt input
- `apps/web/src/client/components/chat/ChatPromptInputFiles.test.tsx` - Integration tests for file picker

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Foundation

Create utility functions and types for file operations. Set up file tree flattening, path parsing, cursor position manipulation, and file type detection. Install Fuse.js dependency. Create comprehensive unit tests to ensure all utilities work correctly before integration.

### Phase 2: Core Implementation

Build the file badge component for visual file type indicators. Update ChatPromptInput to track cursor position and manage file insertion/removal. Refactor ChatPromptInputFiles to fetch files from API, implement Fuse.js search, and build the two-section UI (Added Files + Search Results) matching the design specification.

### Phase 3: Integration

Connect all pieces together, ensure proper data flow from parent to child components, handle edge cases (empty projects, API errors, special characters), add keyboard navigation, and validate the complete user flow from typing `@` to inserting file paths.

## Step by Step Tasks

**IMPORTANT: Execute every step in order, top to bottom**

### 1: Install Dependencies

        - Expected: Testing libraries added to devDependencies

### 2: Create File Utilities

        - Define `FileTypeInfo` interface with: label, color
- [ ] 2.2 Implement flattenFileTree function
        - Recursively traverse FileTreeItem[] structure
        - Extract filename from path (last segment)
        - Extract directory from path (all but last segment)
        - Extract extension from filename (after last dot)
        - Return flat array of FileItem objects
- [ ] 2.3 Implement extractFileReferences function
        - Use regex: `/[a-zA-Z0-9\/\.\-_]+\.[a-z]{2,4}/g` to match file paths
        - Parse textarea content and extract all matching paths
        - Return array of unique file paths
        - Handle empty string edge case
- [ ] 2.4 Implement insertAtCursor function
        - Take current text, insertion string, and cursor position
        - Split text at cursor position
        - Insert new string between parts

        - Return object with new text and cursor position

        - Default: label "FILE", color "rgb(156, 163, 175)" (light gray)
